text.section: An applicant who otherwise qualifies for licensure is entitled to be examined as provided in this section.

An applicant qualifies to take the examination if the applicant:
Has graduated from an accredited college or university with a baccalaureate degree in environmental science or environmental health; and
Has obtained 12 months of experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program approved by the Board;
Has graduated from an accredited college or university with a baccalaureate degree in the physical, biological, or environmental sciences including:
A minimum of 60 semester credit hours or the equivalent quarter credit hours of physical, biological, and environmental sciences acceptable to the Board which includes at least one laboratory course in two of the following fields:
A course in mathematics; and
Has obtained 12 months of experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program approved by the Board;
Has graduated from an accredited college or university with a baccalaureate degree that includes:
30 semester credit hours or the equivalent quarter credit hours in the physical, biological, and environmental sciences acceptable to the Board, which includes at least one laboratory course in two of the following fields:
A course in mathematics; and
Has obtained 24 months of experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program approved by the Board; or
Has graduated from an accredited college or university with a master's degree in public or environmental health science that includes:
30 semester credit hours or 45 quarter credit hours of physical, biological, or environmental sciences acceptable to the Board, which includes at least one laboratory course in two of the following fields:
Chemistry;
Physics; and
Biology;
A course in mathematics; and
3 months of internship approved by the Board if not previously completed.

section.section: This subsection does not alter the requirement that an applicant demonstrate completion of a baccalaureate or master's degree to qualify for examination.

The Board may waive any of the specific course requirements for an applicant to qualify for examination in subsection (b) of this section if the Board determines that an applicant:
Has obtained an equivalent number of credit hours in a course relevant to practice as an environmental health specialist; or
Has work experience that is an acceptable substitute for a course required in subsection (b) of this section.

The Board may waive the experience requirement in subsection (b)(3)(ii) of this section if the Board determines that an applicant:
Has obtained at least 12 months of experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program; and
Has the written support of the applicant's employer.

text.section: The examination shall include a written examination in the physical, biological, and environmental sciences that relates to practices and principles of environmental health.
The Board shall give examinations to applicants at least once a year, at the times and places that the Board determines.
The Board shall notify each qualified applicant of the time and place of examination.

section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, the Board shall determine the subjects, scope, form, and passing score for examinations given under this subtitle.
The Board shall use professional examinations prepared by recognized examination agencies.
Examination papers shall identify the applicant only by a number assigned by the Board secretary.

text.section: Examination papers shall be filed with the Board secretary and kept at least 1 year.

section.section: An applicant who fails an examination may retake the examination as provided in the rules and regulations adopted by the Board.

An applicant for reexamination shall:
Submit to the Board an application on the form the Board requires; and
Pay to the Board a reexamination fee set by the Board.

text.section: Unless authorized by the Board, the consumer members of the Board may not participate in any activity related to examinations under this subtitle.
